column4: hi which vnc viewer/server do I need to install to have an identical one like the one on this website?http://www.realvnc.com/products/download.html tightvnc, vnc4server
most of them work the same. I tend to use vnc4server
also it depends on exactly what you want  to do with vnc.
well I need to get that installed at my uncle who lives about 2 hours driving from my location and take over his computer to help him out
gnome has a vncserver feature built in.. You can use any vnc client to connect.. BUT ovber the wild internet.. Youmay want to check out ssh tunneling of vnc.
if I am correct I need to install the server part at his side and the client one on my side he works with vista
i think the default ubuntu-gnome has one htat will share his 'current' desktop' he can enable.
or install vnc4server. and ssh to allow you to ssh in and start it if needed
but he needs to vnc server to be installed right
i think gnome has one installed by default
system -> preferances -> remote desktop
that part I understood however my uncle works with vista and I need to connect to his pc. does he need to install vnc server or client?
you can install vnc4server in addation to that one thats built in.
theres some default vnc viewer also in ubuntu.. or install one of the others.. and try them out.
ok so he installs ultravnc server and I can connect with the viewer
assuming hte routers are not blocking stuff...
theres also some 'gotomypc' sutes that help do thit task also.
ok thanks
i was thinkng windows vista/xp ? had some built in remote-desktop tool also.. instead of vnc.. but ive never tried those
you are right its the mstc
Does ultravnc also allow outside connections from outside the network?
can you also connect with ultravnc over the internet?
vnc over the internet - is best done with a ssh tunnle. vnc can be insecure.
